parse.title: List of Grey Cup halftime shows

text.*:
This article needs additional citations for verification. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. (November 2014) (Learn how and when to remove this template message)

The following is a list of halftime performances that have occurred at the Grey Cup, the championship game of the Canadian Football League. Until 1989, the Grey Cup halftime performance, if one occurred, was usually a marching band.[1] The 1990 halftime show featured a number of dance teams, then in 1991 the modern style of a performance by a well known (often Canadian) recording artist was introduced, with Luba, Burton Cummings.[1]

History[edit]

78th Grey Cup
  • Date: 1990
  • Location: B.C. Place Stadium
  • Performer(s): Esmeralda Colombian Dance Group, Mlada Srbadia Serbian Folk Dance Group, Joy of Movement Studio, Yuen's Institute of Tae Kwon-do, Joy of Movement Studio, Hungarian Csardas Dancers of Vancouver
79th Grey Cup
  • Date: 1991
  • Location: Winnipeg Stadium
  • Performer(s): Luba, Burton Cummings[1]
80th Grey Cup
  • Date: 1992
  • Location: SkyDome
  • Performer(s): Dan Hill and Celine Dion[1]
  • Setlist:
    • "Love Can Move Mountains" (Celine Dion)
81st Grey Cup
  • Date: 1993
  • Location: McMahon Stadium
  • Performer(s): Miss Molly
82nd Grey Cup
  • Date: 1994
  • Location: BC Place Stadium
  • Performer(s): Tom Cochrane
  • Setlist:
    • "Life Is a Highway"
83rd Grey Cup
  • Date: 1995
  • Location: Taylor Field
  • Performer(s): Jack Semple
84th Grey Cup
  • Date: 1996
  • Location: Ivor Wynne Stadium
  • Performer(s): The Nylons
85th Grey Cup
  • Date: 1997
  • Location: Commonwealth Stadium
  • Performer(s): Trooper
  • Setlist:
    • "Raise a Little Hell"
86th Grey Cup
  • Date: 1998
  • Location: Winnipeg Stadium
  • Performer(s): Love Inc.
87th Grey Cup
  • Date: 1999
  • Location: BC Place Stadium
  • Performer(s): Parablegics
88th Grey Cup
  • Date: 2000
  • Location: McMahon Stadium
  • Performer(s): The Guess Who[1]
  • Setlist:
    • "No Time"
    • "Bus Rider"
89th Grey Cup
  • Date: 2001
  • Location: Olympic Stadium
  • Performer(s): Sass Jordan and Michel Pagliaro
90th Grey Cup
  • Date: 2002
  • Location: Commonwealth Stadium
  • Performer(s): Shania Twain[1]
  • Setlist:[1]
    • "I'm Gonna Getcha Good!"
    • "Up!"
91st Grey Cup
  • Date: 2003
  • Location: Taylor Field
  • Performer(s): Bryan Adams and Sam Roberts
  • Setlist:
    • "Can't Stop This Thing We Started" (Bryan Adams)
    • "Where Have All the Good People Gone?" (Sam Roberts)
    • "Summer of '69" (Bryan Adams)
92nd Grey Cup
  • Date: 2004
  • Location: Frank Clair Stadium
  • Performer(s): The Tragically Hip
  • Setlist:
    • "Gus: The Polar Bear from Central Park"
    • "Courage"
93rd Grey Cup
  • Date: 2005
  • Location: BC Place Stadium
  • Performer(s): The Black Eyed Peas[1]
  • Setlist:
    • "Pump It"
    • "Don't Phunk with My Heart"
    • "My Humps"
94th Grey Cup
  • Date: 2006
  • Location: Canad Inns Stadium
  • Performer(s): Nelly Furtado featuring Saukrates
  • Setlist:
    • "Força"
    • "Promiscuous"
    • "Maneater"
95th Grey Cup
  • Date: 2007
  • Location: Rogers Centre
  • Performer(s): Lenny Kravitz
  • Setlist:
    • "Bring It On"
    • "American Woman"
    • "Are You Gonna Go My Way"
96th Grey Cup
  • Date: 2008
  • Location: Olympic Stadium
  • Performer(s): Theory of a Deadman, Suzie McNeil, and Andrée Watters
  • Setlist:
    • "So Happy (Theory of a Deadman)
    • "No Surprise" (Theory of a Deadman)
    • "Believe" (Theory of a Deadman with Suzie McNeil)
    • "Minuit" (Andrée Watters)
97th Grey Cup
  • Date: 2009
  • Location: McMahon Stadium
  • Performer(s): Blue Rodeo
  • Setlist:
    • "Til I Am Myself Again"
    • "Hasn't Hit Me Yet"
    • "Lost Together"
98th Grey Cup
  • Date: 2010
  • Location: Commonwealth Stadium
  • Performer(s): Bachman & Turner[1]
  • Setlist:
    • "Roll On Down the Highway"
    • "You Ain't Seen Nothing Yet"
    • "Let It Ride"
    • "Slave To The Rhythm"
    • "Takin' Care of Business"
99th Grey Cup
  • Date: 2011
  • Location: BC Place Stadium
  • Performer(s): Nickelback[1]
  • Setlist:[1]
    • "Animals"
    • "When We Stand Together"
    • "Burn It to the Ground"
100th Grey Cup
  • Date: 2012
  • Location: Rogers Centre
  • Performer(s): Justin Bieber, Carly Rae Jepsen, Marianas Trench, Gordon Lightfoot[1]
  • Setlist:
    • "Canadian Railroad Trilogy" (Gordon Lightfoot)
    • "Stutter" (Marianas Trench)
    • "This Kiss" (Carly Rae Jepsen)
    • "Call Me Maybe" (Carly Rae Jepsen)
    • "Boyfriend" (Justin Bieber)
    • "Beauty and a Beat" (Justin Bieber)
101st Grey Cup
  • Date: November 24, 2013
  • Location: Mosaic Stadium at Taylor Field
  • Performer(s): Hedley
  • Setlist:
    • "Anything"
    • "Invincible"
    • "Cha-Ching"
102nd Grey Cup
  • Date: November 30, 2014
  • Location: BC Place Stadium
  • Performer(s): Imagine Dragons[1][2]
  • Setlist:
    • "I Bet My Life"
    • "Demons"
    • "Radioactive"
103rd Grey Cup
  • Date: November 29, 2015
  • Location: Investors Group Field
  • Sponsor: Nissan Titan
  • Performer(s): Fall Out Boy[1]
  • Setlist:
    • "Centuries"
    • "Irresistible"
    • "Uma Thurman"
    • "Thnks fr th Mmrs"
    • "My Songs Know What You Did in the Dark (Light Em Up)"
104th Grey Cup
  • Date: November 27, 2016
  • Location: BMO Field
  • Sponsor: Freedom Mobile
  • Performer(s): OneRepublic[3]
  • Setlist:
    • "Love Runs Out"
    • "Let's Hurt Tonight"
    • "Counting Stars"
105th Grey Cup
  • Date: November 26, 2017
  • Location: TD Place Stadium
  • Sponsor: Shaw
  • Performer(s): Shania Twain[4]
  • Setlist:
    • "That Don't Impress Me Much"
    • "Life's About to Get Good"
    • "Man! I Feel Like A Woman!" [5]

References[edit]

  1. ^ a b c d e f g h i j k l m n Braun, Liz (2015-11-27). "The most notable Grey Cup halftime shows". 24 Hours Vancouver. Postmedia Network. Retrieved 2017-11-30. 
  2. ^ "Imagine Dragons to fire up Grey Cup's halftime show". Vancouver Sun. Retrieved 27 November 2014. 
  3. ^ "OneRepublic to headline 2016 Grey Cup halftime show". Global News. Retrieved 8 September 2016. 
  4. ^ "Grammy winner Shania Twain to perform at Freedom Mobile Grey Cup Halftime Show". CFL. Retrieved 8 September 2016. 
  5. ^ http://leaderpost.com/entertainment/music/shania-twain-wows-grey-cup-halftime-show/wcm/b1bb28cb-03aa-47f4-8335-324d3c24cc5c
